text.text: Perfect! Here's everything about the *Flask adapter*:
The Flask adapter provides a simple handler class that bridges Flask and Bolt:

‣ *Request/Response Translation*: Converts between Flask and Bolt formats
‣ *OAuth Flow Support*: Handles installation and OAuth redirect routes automatically
‣ *Event Dispatching*: Routes POST requests to the Bolt app

‣ *GET `/install`* - OAuth installation flow (if OAuth is enabled)
‣ *GET `/oauth_redirect`* - OAuth callback after authorization
‣ *POST* - All Slack events, actions, commands, etc.

‣ `to_bolt_request()` - Converts Flask Request → BoltRequest
‣ `to_flask_response()` - Converts BoltResponse → Flask Response

```
from slack_bolt import App
from slack_bolt.adapter.flask import SlackRequestHandler
from flask import Flask, request

# Create Bolt app
app = App()

@app.event("app_mention")
def event_test(body, say, logger):
    logger.info(body)
    say("What's up?")

# Create Flask app and handler
flask_app = Flask(__name__)
handler = SlackRequestHandler(app)

@flask_app.route("/slack/events", methods=["POST"])
def slack_events():
    return handler.handle(request)
```

```
# Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Set environment variables
export SLACK_SIGNING_SECRET=***
export SLACK_BOT_TOKEN=xoxb-***

# Run Flask
FLASK_APP=app.py FLASK_ENV=development flask run -p 3000
```

‣ *Simple Integration*: Just 3 lines to connect Bolt to Flask
‣ *Automatic OAuth*: Handler manages OAuth flows if configured
‣ *Full Flask Compatibility*: Works with all Flask features and extensions
‣ *Synchronous*: Perfect for traditional Flask apps (use FastAPI/Starlette for async)
The Flask adapter is one of the simplest and most straightforward adapters in the collection!
